meta.title: April 2020 National Exam COVID-19 - The ACT Test | ACT

meta.content: April 2020 National Exam COVID-19 - The ACT Test

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: covid 19, coronavirus and the act test

div.p: Product updates, digital learning, and workforce resources to assist students, teachers, schools, and workers impacted by COVID-19.
Frequently Asked Questions

The safety of students and test center staff is ACT’s top priority. ACT has rescheduled its April 4 national test date to June 13 across the U.S. in response to concerns about the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19). All students registered for the April 4 test date received an email from ACT informing them of the postponement and instructions for free rescheduling to June 13 or a future national test date.

h4.a: Is ACT still holding its April 4, 2020 national test?

div.p: No. ACT has rescheduled its April 4 national test date to June 13 across the U.S. in response to concerns about the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19). All students registered for the April 4 test date will receive an email from ACT in the next few days informing them of the postponement and instructions for free rescheduling to June 13 or a future national test date.

h4.a: What happens next for students who were registered...

div.p: All students registered for the April 4 test date will receive an email from ACT in the next few days informing them of the postponement and instructions for free rescheduling to June 13 or a future ACT national test date.

h4.a: When are the next ACT national test dates?

div.p: The next ACT national test dates are June 13 and July 18.

h4.a: Will ACT automatically register impacted students for the next test date?

div.p: No. All students registered for the April 4 test date will receive an email from ACT in the next few days informing them of the instructions for free rescheduling to June 13 or a future ACT national test date.

h4.a: What will happen if students cannot take the ACT on one of the future...

p.b: ...test dates or don’t wish to reschedule their test?

div.p: Students who can’t or don’t wish to reschedule may receive a refund of their April registration fee.

h4.a: What will ACT do for high school seniors who are applying...

p.b: ...for fall 2020 college admissions and are facing deadlines?

div.p: ACT is committed to making every effort to help students impacted by this test date change, particularly seniors facing college application deadlines for this fall. More information will be released as it becomes available in the days ahead. You’ll find the latest updates on act.org.

h4.a: Why did ACT decide not to hold its April ACT test date?

div.p: The safety of students and test center staff is ACT’s top priority. We believe this decision is in the best interests of public safety and health.

h4.a: What is the best way to reach an ACT representative...

div.p: Please look for information about your April test registration through email or mail from ACT. You’ll also find the latest updates on ACT.org.

If you have questions, you can reach us by calling, emailing or live chat; see our website. Our team may be working with a number of students individually, so we appreciate your patience during this time.

h4.a: I registered with a Fee Waiver, do I have to pay any fees to...

div.p: You can log into your ACT account and make a test date change without incurring any fee because you used a fee waiver.

h4.a: Can I still request a TIR for Special Testing or Non-Saturday Testing?

div.p: Yes, ACT will be offering an option for Non-Saturday and Special testing for the June 2020 test date.

ul.li: If you ordered the April Test Information Release and requested a Non-Saturday test date: You may self-service through your ACT account.

If you ordered the April TIR for Special Testing: The currently held check will be returned to you via mail. The updated supplemental order forms will be posted (no later than March 20) at www.act.org/the-act/tir.

h4.a: What if I am taking the April ACT in an international test center?

div.p: The April test dates for international have been postponed. For more information please visit http://global.act.org/content/global/en/covid-19-international.html

h4.a: Where can students get more information about testing...

p.b: ...that was supposed to take place during the school day, provided by their state or district?

div.p: Students who are testing as part of a state or district testing program should reach out to their school for the status of their testing.

h4.a: Where can schools and/or districts scheduled to participate...

p.b: ...in ACT District Testing go for more information?

div.p: Please visit https://success.act.org/s/article/ACT-District-Testing-and-the-Coronavirus-COVID-19 for FAQs and your district testing web page for the most current information about ACT District Testing.

div.h4: Where will you take the ACT Test?

div.p: If you are accessing this site from outside the United States, Puerto Rico, or U.S. Territories, please proceed to the Non-U.S. version of our web site.
